bill.title: Elections; define residence of candidates.
bill.description: An Act To Provide That Any Person Desiring To Be A Candidate For An Office Shall Be A Resident Of The State, State District, County, County District, Municipality, Or Municipal Ward Which Such Person Seeks To Serve By 5:00 P.m. On The Qualifying Deadline Day Provided By Statute For Such Office; To Define How The Appropriate Person, Executive Committee Or Commission Shall Determine The Residence Of Any Person Seeking To Be A Candidate; To Amend Sections 23-15-299, 23-15-309, 23-15-359 And 23-15-361, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Sections; To Bring Forward Section 23-15-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Election Of Commissioners Of Election; And For Related Purposes.
